meanings.definition: relating to the cultivation of forests
meanings.sent1: The silviculturally minded forester carefully planned the tree planting.
meanings.sent2: The silviculturally managed forest thrived under expert care.
meanings.sent3: The silviculturally inclined squirrel decided to plant acorns in neat rows.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked silviculturally, nurturing ideas like seeds in a forest.
meanings.sent5: The silviculturally rich landscape painted a picture of green abundance.

meanings.definition: in a manner related to the management of forest resources
meanings.sent1: The team worked silviculturally to ensure sustainable logging practices.
meanings.sent2: They monitored the forest silviculturally to prevent overharvesting.
meanings.sent3: The owl hooted silviculturally, reminding the animals to conserve resources.
meanings.sent4: Time moved silviculturally, each season bringing new challenges to the forest.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed silviculturally, providing life to the surrounding trees.
